page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block includes the outskirts of the built up area of Blackburn. The northernmost third is covered by an area of housing. This housing is mainly 20th century development encroaching on farmland, the land cover in the other two thirds of the block. Farming in the area is the keeping of dairy cows, many farmers bottling and selling their milk directly, rather than through a dairy. The rural area contains one village, Tockholes, at one time a farming village, now inhabited by Blackburn commuters. Parts of the eastern area of the block are given over to recreation, namely Blackburn Rovers Football ground and Darwen Golf Club.
